posts.name: Ryan Voss
posts.cooked: I love the addition of reactions. However, in big group chats with lots of other people who also love them, I wind up with a neverending deluge of notifications just for all the reactions. Is there a way to keep notifications for actual messages on, but disable or mute notifications for reactions? If not, could one be added?
On Android this could be realised via notification channels while not adding any internal settings, just how the signal team likes itüôÉ

posts.name: Roderick
posts.cooked: I‚Äôm very surprised this post hasn‚Äôt gotten more interest, as I‚Äôm a new user of Signal and it‚Äôs an obvious issue. I can have notifications for every reaction and new message, with my phone constantly going off, or none at all. That‚Äôs not great‚Ä¶
This isn‚Äôt just annoying with big groups, it‚Äôs ‚Äústart looking for another messaging client‚Äù bad when your significant other can‚Äôt prevent themselves from reacting to every freaking message.

posts.name: Frank
posts.cooked:
It would be nice to be able to give the notifications that someone reacted to a message of mine a different sound/vibration/priority when it happens.
Personally, I silence these messages and give them a low priority with other chat apps. They aren‚Äôt usually important for the flow of the conversation.

I don‚Äôt even think you would need to give custom settings for each chat. I would be happy with making this a global option only.

MS Teams has it and it‚Äòs quite useful. Usually most reactions are confirmative anyways and if people disagree they tend to do so with ‚Äûreal‚Äú text messages.

I deactivated all reaction notifications in Teams and it really helps to focus.

posts.name: Trevor Ellermann
posts.cooked:
This really would be the biggest quality of life change I could imagine on my phone. I use signal as my primary messenger and multiple times a day I have to stop what I‚Äôm doing and pull out my phone only to see that someone put a thumbs up on a message. It‚Äôs super frustrating to be interrupted for something that I know is never important.

If I could just switch reactions to silent notifications or even turn off notifications all together it would really improve my life.

topic:14931:

I have to stop what I‚Äôm doing and pull out my phone only to see that someone put a thumbs up on a message.

what is the difference between -reaction and a message with only ‚Äú‚Äù (or any other emoji) ???
Is this also ‚ÄúI know is never important‚Äù?

Reaction has the advantage that in the group only the sender of the message is notified.

anon88132:

what is the difference between -reaction and a message with only ‚Äú‚Äù (or any other emoji) ???
Is this also ‚ÄúI know is never important‚Äù?

Yes, you bring up a fair point. But with reactions, the frequency is higher afaik than just an emoji + we know that ALL reactions are not messages

I do not question the need for this FR! but the ‚Äúreasoning‚Äù that all reactions are not messages or never important.

As I said, there is no difference (content-wise) between one-emoji messages and reactions! In fact, they are less intrusive (in groups).

What do you do when from the moment the reactions are muted, you get ONLY one-emoji messages instead? Also here an option to mute them ? And then, messages with only one letter/number?
So, all these messages are equal and can answer a specific question.

(exaggerated ) example:

We have these 3 options:

  1. cinema
  2. pub
  3. soccer

where is the difference if I reply with reaction or as extra message with

  • ,
  • soccer,
  • 3,
  • third option,
  • I need fresh air!
  • ‚Ä¶

EDIT: typo

anon88132:

where is the difference if I reply with reaction or as extra message with

Nothing functionally

Blue42:

But with reactions, the frequency is higher afaik than just an emoji + we know that ALL reactions are not messages
I can not confirm this at all: in my ‚Äúcircle‚Äù almost no one uses the reactions. They are rather one-emoji respectively sticker fans.
Okay, so what? Then an option to mute reactions doesn‚Äôt concern you at all

posts.name: Jonny Dee
posts.cooked:
In bigger groups, the members will learn pretty soon that it is not a good idea to react with a message (or another emoji). In addition, you can tell them to please use reactions instead should they not have this idea themselves. Reactions just keep the chat tidy while normal messages used for reactions don‚Äôt.

In addition, if there is an option to mute reactions it will be even more likely that people use them instead of messages because constantly being interrupted by reactions sent as normal messages by 50 or more members each time someone posts something in a group really is annoying‚Ä¶

posts.name: Rusty Russell
posts.cooked:
Just opened a feature request that got closed as a dupe of this.

I want a separate custom notification for reactions. This would be a killer addition for messages from my SO.

Whom do I bribe?

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
rustyrussell:

Whom do I bribe?

you can always bribe the Signal dev by submitting a well-made PR that implements this feature
Yes, this absolutely needs to be a feature since reactions can be plentiful in large groups. Notification channels would be a great way to do this.

posts.name: Charles
posts.cooked: Just got into a bigger group chat on Signal and surprised to find this feature isn‚Äôt there. Discord has been mentioned but WhatsApp (more obvious competitor IMO) also supports this. I would really prefer not to disable notifications entirely for the group. Any signs of this happening?

cmorris:

disable notifications entirely for the group

If you don‚Äôt want notifications from the group at all, I would suggest muting it. At least on iOS, it is possible to still receive notifications from mentions when the group is muted, which I find helpful.

posts.name: Charles
posts.cooked: Apologies, I meant to say ‚Äúprefer not to disable notifications for the group.‚Äù (I fixed the original post.) My ideal is to see new messages but not get bombarded with every reaction.
